Articles.Content:
1.2.2 Compatible(If you find a bug please report it here)

Low Expectations Inc is a part pack with all the parts you never knew you wanted. This is my first mod/pack so any feedback is welcome.

Feel free to work on this mod either with me or on your lonesome, currently I am looking for someone who can do stock-a-like textures.

Part suggestions are welcome.

This Mod is licensed under CC BY-NC 4.0 , License is included within the download.

 

Download: http://spacedock.info/mod/957/Low Expectations Inc

Screenshots:

Parts Left to Right: 45 degree adapter(1.25meter) , Resource Jettison Module, Engineer Assist Inline Module, Modular Girder Adapter(0.625meter), Radial Engineer Assist Module, Ablative Nose Cone(may need work), Mk2 Radial Fuel Tank.

 

Source Code: https://github.com/McClainJ/Low_Expectations

Changelog:

Spoiler

0.1 Release.

0.2 Fixed adapter node angle.

0.3 Fixed graphics glitch from the unity model port.

0.32 Fixed UV map flip inversion for anyone who wants to make a texture, it should now be about 100x easier. (this also removed a small graphics issue.)

0.33 Added new Modular Girder to 0.625m adapter.

0.4 Added new Engineer Assist Module (0.625m) right click part to access information.

0.48 EXPERIMENTAL, ADDING TEXTURE SOON.

0.5 All Parts textures and fine tuned. game play "ready". Still working on mirror placement issues with the 45 adapter.(they work, but you will find yourself reattaching base pieces a lot.)(Radial works fine.)

0.52 Re-textured the Engineer Assist Module, cleaned up the engineer assist display, added auto-jettison for the jettison module, and got 95% of the mirror symmetry stuff working for the 45 adapter.

0.56 Added Radial Engineer Assist Module, Added gui for the Engineer Assist Module, Added cycle rate option for Auto-Jettison.

0.6 Added Auto-Burn Function for Engineer Assist. Added Ablative Nose Cone. Added Radial Mk2 Fuel Tank/Engine Mount

0.63 Checked for Compatibility with 1.2 and tweaked the nose cone a little, may still need work.

0.64 Checked for Compatibility with 1.2.2.

0.65 Updated License.

 

Edited January 31, 2017 by Electr0ninja
Update

This is cool. I like new parts. I have one suggestion/request and one bug. I suggest/request other versions of the same part to fit the other standard sizes. The bug is that the attachment node on the free end doesn't point at 45 degrees, but attaches as standard, as you see with the engine.

 

My expectations were higher

14 minutes ago, Rocket Surgeon said:

This is cool. I like new parts. I have one suggestion/request and one bug. I suggest/request other versions of the same part to fit the other standard sizes. The bug is that the attachment node on the free end doesn't point at 45 degrees, but attaches as standard, as you see with the engine.

Not a mod bug. Edit: Totally fixed, my bad I misunderstood the config.

Edited September 24, 2016 by Electr0ninja

2 minutes ago, Electr0ninja said:

Not a mod bug, ksp only allows cardinal directions for nodes

Are you certain? I've never known this to be the case.

8 minutes ago, Rocket Surgeon said:

Are you certain? I've never known this to be the case.

I will double check the config api, Turns out I was mistaken.

Edited September 24, 2016 by Electr0ninja
I could be wrong!

Ok it seems to be working, but who would have thought they would use a ratio based system for allocating angles. I will update the download shortly.

Edited September 24, 2016 by Electr0ninja

Just now, Rocket Surgeon said:

Ty for the tip. Just checked and it should be good to go, if you wanna test it.

Yep, perfect.

Edited September 24, 2016 by Rocket Surgeon

Cool, you got it through Unity! 

Do you think you could work with me on a mod that I need help modelling for?

Edited September 24, 2016 by njmksr
@njmksr What is the mod about? Would it be something we could pair together, or do you want it separate?

Updated the model to fix a minor graphics glitch. Re-download to fix the problem, if it is an issue

9/25/16: Updated and added a new part. the Modular Girder Adapter. (allows surface attachment). (Still looking for a texture artists)

Edited September 26, 2016 by Electr0ninja

9/26/16 Added a new Part, The "Engineer Assist Module" right click it to access the information display, contains all the information you should need for simple orbital maneuvers and landing.

(Shows inclination, and indicates when you reach an Ascending node and a Descending node using the Latitude indicator.(hint. if your latitude is 0, you are at a AN/DN .)

Edited September 26, 2016 by Electr0ninja

Oh you are the best. Normally I have to pester some kind random modder to make such a thing for me. Finally someone else who thinks it's a good idea! (Should be vanilla to have orbital data on the HUD)

Edited September 26, 2016 by Rocket Surgeon

Hey, got an issue when putting multiple parts on mirrored/radial at once. Kinda puts a damper in vtols lol

If you can, you should also make it able to be placed radially without needing a cubic octagonal strut
 

 

(look! Pictures!)

Spoiler


 

Edited September 26, 2016 by stickman939

4 hours ago, stickman939 said:

Hey, got an issue when putting multiple parts on mirrored/radial at once. Kinda puts a damper in vtols lol

If you can, you should also make it able to be placed radially without needing a cubic octagonal strut

 


 

First note( making a 45 degree angled part work in ksp is hard. The editor doesn't like it, the colliders setup doesn't like it. And part mirror doesn't like it.)(any advice of methods to fix these would be greatly appreciated)

 

I wish that it could be fixed, but in order for the attachment nodes to work at a 45 degree angle, the center of mass is mathematically not going to be aligned with the part in mirror mode, radial symmetry will probably be okay.

The current method that will work is to align your cubic octagonal strut where you want it, then attach the parts radially.

In regards to surface attachment, it can be done. But since the collider is not 100% perfect  (due to it not being concave) it could produce some minor issues. I can give you a link to a modified config for surface attachment if you wish.(or you can just change the part config file to allow it)

I could however align the center of mass with the bottom node so that it attaches correctly when you use the bottom for the attachment, but it would be 2x as bad if you used the other side.

SOLUTION: after you offest everything where you want it, just reattache the 45 degree adapter and then everything after it in the part tree. Say if you have an engine,  just reattach the 45 to the cubic strut, then reattach the engine.

 

@Rocket Surgeon , Thank you .

Glad it is of help, took all night.

Edited September 26, 2016 by Electr0ninja

You mean srfAttach? I was gong to suggest this (as well as nodeAttach at the same time), but I figured one could always just use "BZ-52 Radial Attachment Point".

 

But it'd be nice.

Edited September 26, 2016 by Rocket Surgeon

2 minutes ago, Rocket Surgeon said:

You mean srfAttach? I was gong to suggest this (as well as nodeAttach at the same time), but I figured one could always just use "BZ-52 Radial Attachment Point".

 

But it'd be nice.

 

On concave hulls: Does it have to be? Would a cube not work just as well for this particular part? (note: IANAM - I Am Not A Modder)

Fair enough, I can use a rectangle collider and it would work just fine(unity won't mind), but collisions would be very inaccurate. since the rectangle would either keep you from getting close to the side of the part, or i would let you clip into the part upon a collision. Note: And I did use the bz-52 in my mirror and radial symmetry tests, as the base attachment part.

 

Plan: I will try to find a point that will be good for part to surface attach. might be able to get it working.

Edited September 26, 2016 by Electr0ninja

3 minutes ago, Electr0ninja said:

I wish that it could be fixed, but in order for the attachment nodes to work at a 45 degree angle, the center of mass is mathematically not going to be aligned with the part in mirror mode

Shame. Damn limitations. Oh well lol.

Shame. Damn limitations. Oh well lol.

wish it could be fixed, but every fix just breaks more things lol.

You can always just not use symmetry once you get to those parts, and place them 1 at a time.

Also, if someone volunteers to make a stock-alike texture, I can make a part specifically for attaching radially, that lets you attach vertical engines.
